document.docAuthor: Reuscher, Michael, Fiege, Dieter & Wehe, Thomas
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species of Ampharetidae (Annelida: Polychaeta) from Pacific hot vents and cold seeps, with a key and synoptic table of characters for all genera

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species of Ampharetidae (Annelida: Polychaeta) from Pacific hot vents and cold seeps, with a key and synoptic table of characters for all genera

paragraph.keyLead: 1. 3–4 anterior segments with fine acicular neurochaetae. Chaetae on segment II (paleae) absent. Post-branchial hooks may be present ......................................................................................................................................... Melinninae ... 2

- 2–4 pairs of branchiae, 2 pairs papillose. 12–13 thoracic uncinigers ..................................................................
Isolda

9 . First abdominal segment with fan–shaped structures connected by dorsal membrane ..........................
Jugamphicteis

10 . Posterior thorax with modified segment: elevated notopodia, may be connected by dorsal glandular ridge, with mod- ified capillary chaetae or prolonged segments............................................................................................................ 11

11. 4 th, 5 th or 6 th last notopodia elevated or with modified capillary chaetae; alternatively, last few thoracic chaetigers prolonged .........................................................................................................................................
Anobothrus
(part)
14 . Prostomial glandular ridges or nuchal organs referred to as glandular ridges present ............................................... 15
- Prostomial glandular ridges or nuchal organs referred to as glandular ridges absent ............................................... 21

17 . Abdominal segments with none or few rudimentary notopodia. Anal cirri absent ......................................
Hobsonia

- Abdominal segments with rudimentary notopodia. Anal cirri present .......................................................
Amphicteis

19 . Abdominal rudimentary notopodia absent; club-shaped notopodial cirri absent ......................................
Grubianella
- Abdominal rudimentary notopodia present; club-shaped notopodial cirri present..................................................... 20

20. 2 – 3 anteriormost thoracic notopodia rudimentary. Pre-branchial segments not fused ventrally .................
Mexamage

- Anteriormost thoracic notopodia not rudimentary. Pre-branchial segments fused ventrally ...................
Amage
(part)

31 . Buccal tentacles absent. Jaw structures present. Chaetae on segment II (paleae) present .................
Gnathampharete
- Buccal tentacles present. Jaw structures absent. Chaetae on segment II (paleae) present or absent ......................... 32
- Branchiae arranged 2 + 2 or in transverse row. Branchiae of uniform size.................................................................. 34

- Branchiae arranged in transverse row. Lower lip not crenulated ...................................................................
Pavelius

36 . Chaetae on segment II (paleae) present. Up to 26 abdominal segments ......................................................
Ampharete
- Chaetae on segment II (paleae) absent. More than 30 abdominal segments .............................................................. 37

43. 3 pairs of branchiae in transverse row, 4 th pair behind outermost pair of transverse row.............................
Lysippides

- Branchiae arranged 2 + 1 + 1 . Chaetae on segment II (paleae) large. Anal cirri absent ..................................
Hypaniola
46 . Last thoracic segment with elevated notopodia and modified notochaetae................................................................ 47

48 . First abdominal segment with fan-shaped structures connected by dorsal membrane....................................
Ymerana

49. 5 th last thoracic unciniger with elevated notopodia connected by dorsal glandular ridge ............
Anobothrus laubieri
52 . Prostomial glandular ridges or nuchal organ referred to as glandular ridges present................................................. 53
- Prostomial glandular ridges or nuchal organ referred to as glandular ridges absent .................................................. 54

60 . Last 5 thoracic segments at least 3 times longer than anterior ones ...........................................................
Eclysippe

- Last 5 thoracic segments not conspicuously prolonged..........................................................................
Parampharete
- Less than 14 thoracic uncinigers. Chaetae on segment II (paleae) absent................................................................. 70
70. 12 thoracic uncinigers. First row of uncini about 2 times longer than remaining ones............................................. 71
- Less than 12 thoracic uncinigers. First row of uncini not prolonged ........................................................................ 72

72. 10 thoracic uncinigers. 2 nd last pair of notopodia elevated, connected by dorsal glandular ridge................
Zatsepinia
